Sentencas: A micro-scale model of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) involving the mass transfer together with the electrochemical reaction, the electron and ion transports through the respective spherically shaped electron-and ion-conducting particles inside the electrodes was mathematically developed.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes

Sentencas: Couples of useful dimensionless parameters were introduced in order to represent the characteristics of the cell.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes

Sentencas: The predicted cell performance was showed according to various operating and design conditions.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes

Sentencas: The effects of micro-scale electrode geometry on the cell performance were also taken into account.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes

Sentencas: Parametric study according to the volumetric fraction of ionic and electronic conducting particles was conducted in order to examine the effects of operating conditions on the cell overpotentials.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes

Sentencas: The study results substantiate the fact that SOFC overpotential could be effectively decreased by increasing the operating temperature as well as operating pressure.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes

Sentencas: This present study reveals the working mechanisms of SOFC at the micro-scale level, while demonstrating the use of micro-scale relations to enhance the SOFC performance.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes

Sentencas: The accuracy of the presented model was validated by comparing to already existing experimental results from the available literatures.
Titulo: A solid oxide fuel cell micro-scale modeling with spherical particle shaped electrodes
